Get a sampling function for reporting delays

get_delay_sample_fn.Rd

Get a sampling function for reporting delays

get_delay_sample_fn(
  linelist,
  verbose = FALSE,
  samples = 1,
  bootstraps = 1,
  bootstrap_samples = 250
)

Arguments

linelist

Dataframe with a delay_confirmation date variable
verbose

Logical, defaults to FALSE. Should progress messages be printed
bootstraps

Numeric, defaults to 1. The number of bootstrap samples (with replacement) of the delay distribution to take.
bootstrap_samples

Numeric, defaults to 100. The number of samples to take in each boostrap. When the sample size of the supplied delay distribution is less than 100 this is used instead.

Value

A list of function that takes one parameter, n, the number of reporting delays to randomly sample

Examples


## Example
if (FALSE) {
get_delay_sample_fn()
}

## Code
get_delay_sample_fn
#> function (linelist, verbose = FALSE, samples = 1, bootstraps = 1, 
#>     bootstrap_samples = 250) 
#> {
#>     delays <- linelist %>% .$delay_confirmation %>% as.integer() %>% 
#>         .[!is.na(.)] %>% .[. >= 0]
#>     get_single_delay_fn <- function(confirmation_delays = NULL, 
#>         samples = 1) {
#>         max_delay <- max(confirmation_delays) + 1
#>         fit_exp <- EpiNow::dist_fit(confirmation_delays, samples = samples, 
#>             dist = "exp")
#>         if (length(confirmation_delays) >= 30) {
#>             fit_gam <- EpiNow::dist_fit(confirmation_delays, 
#>                 samples = samples, dist = "gamma")
#>             log_lik_exp <- loo::extract_log_lik(fit_exp, merge_chains = FALSE)
#>             log_lik_gam <- loo::extract_log_lik(fit_gam, merge_chains = FALSE)
#>             rel_exp <- loo::relative_eff(exp(log_lik_exp))
#>             rel_gam <- loo::relative_eff(exp(log_lik_gam))
#>             loo_exp <- loo::loo(log_lik_exp, r_eff = rel_exp)
#>             loo_gam <- loo::loo(log_lik_gam, r_eff = rel_gam)
#>             best_model <- ifelse(loo_exp$estimates[3, 1] < loo_gam$estimates[3, 
#>                 1], "exp", "gamma")
#>         }
#>         else {
#>             best_model <- "exp"
#>         }
#>         if (best_model == "exp") {
#>             if (verbose) {
#>                 message("Exponential selected as the best fit for the delay distribution")
#>             }
#>             delay_rate <- sample(rstan::extract(fit_exp)$lambda, 
#>                 samples)
#>             sample_functions <- delay_rate %>% purrr::map(function(par) {
#>                 sample_function <- function(n, dist = FALSE, 
#>                   cum = TRUE, max_delay = NULL) {
#>                   if (!dist) {
#>                     rexp(n, par)
#>                   }
#>                   else {
#>                     if (length(n) > max_delay) {
#>                       n <- 1:max_delay
#>                     }
#>                     if (cum) {
#>                       pexp(n, par)
#>                     }
#>                     else {
#>                       dexp(n, par)
#>                     }
#>                   }
#>                 }
#>             })
#>         }
#>         else if (best_model == "gamma") {
#>             if (verbose) {
#>                 message("Gamma selected as the best fit for the delay distribution")
#>             }
#>             delay_alpha <- sample(rstan::extract(fit_gam)$alpha, 
#>                 samples)
#>             delay_beta <- sample(rstan::extract(fit_gam)$beta, 
#>                 samples)
#>             sample_functions <- purrr::map2(delay_alpha, delay_beta, 
#>                 function(alpha, beta) {
#>                   sample_function <- function(n, dist = FALSE, 
#>                     cum = TRUE, max_delay = NULL) {
#>                     if (!dist) {
#>                       rgamma(n, alpha, beta)
#>                     }
#>                     else {
#>                       if (length(n) > max_delay) {
#>                         n <- 1:max_delay
#>                       }
#>                       if (cum) {
#>                         pgamma(n, alpha, beta)
#>                       }
#>                       else {
#>                         dgamma(n, alpha, beta)
#>                       }
#>                     }
#>                   }
#>                 })
#>         }
#>         truncated_sample_functions <- sample_functions %>% purrr::map(function(sample_function) {
#>             truncated_sample_function <- function(n, dist = FALSE, 
#>                 cum = TRUE) {
#>                 n <- sample_function(n, dist, cum, get("max_delay"))
#>                 if (!dist) {
#>                   while (any(!is.na(n) & n >= get("max_delay"))) {
#>                     n <- ifelse(n >= get("max_delay"), sample_function(n), 
#>                       n)
#>                   }
#>                   n <- as.integer(n)
#>                 }
#>                 return(n)
#>             }
#>         })
#>         return(truncated_sample_functions)
#>     }
#>     if (bootstraps == 1) {
#>         truncated_sample_functions <- get_single_delay_fn(delays, 
#>             samples = samples)
#>     }
#>     else {
#>         truncated_sample_functions <- furrr::future_map(1:bootstraps, 
#>             ~get_single_delay_fn(sample(delays, min(length(delays), 
#>                 bootstrap_samples), replace = TRUE), samples = ceiling(samples/bootstraps)), 
#>             .progress = FALSE)
#>         truncated_sample_functions <- purrr::flatten(truncated_sample_functions)
#>         sample_indexs <- sample(1:length(truncated_sample_functions), 
#>             samples, replace = FALSE)
#>         truncated_sample_functions <- truncated_sample_functions[sample_indexs]
#>     }
#>     return(truncated_sample_functions)
#> }
#> <bytecode: 0x559f7d6da958>
#> <environment: namespace:EpiNow>
